intro: Gurania sarana, commonly known as the wild betel vine, is a climbing plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Menispermaceae and is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and yellowish flowers. The plant produces small, fleshy fruits that are typically green when immature and turn red when mature. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in moist, shaded environments. Its botanical features make it an important species in traditional medicine and local ecosystems.
